paper_metadata.title: Long-run effects of a 'big-push' asset transfer program

component_a_cash_support.cash_evidence_citation: In addition to the asset they received weekly consumption support for 30-40 weeks

component_b_assets.assets_evidence_citation: Households in the treatment group who chose to participate chose a productive asset from a menu of options (2 cows, 4 goats, 1 cow and 2 goats, nonfarm microenterprise inventory, etc). About 82% chose livestock.

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: recording household demographics, consumption, food security, asset ownership, income, income sources, financial inclusion, adult time use, and physical and mental wellbeing
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: In a randomized controlled trial that follows these households over 10 years

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: The NGO Bandhan ran the TUP program in West Bengal starting in 2007
evidence_citations.country_citation: The NGO Bandhan ran the TUP program in West Bengal starting in 2007
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: The poorest households were identified in two steps. First, residents across 120 village hamlets ranked households into five wealth quintiles. Among households ranked in the bottom quintile Bandhan then verified eligibility
